action.action-desc: Mr. Foster (for himself, Mr. Meeks, Ms. Judy Chu of California, and Mr. Swalwell of California) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to allow certain payments made by public service employees to qualify for public service repayment, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Inclusion Act of 2018.

subsection.text: Section 455(m) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087e(m)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1)(A) by inserting subject to paragraph (5), before has made; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: For the purpose of meeting the requirement under subparagraph (A) of paragraph (1), the first 60 monthly payments may be payments under a repayment plan under subsection (d)(1) or (g).
This paragraph shall apply to borrowers who on or after the date of the enactment of this paragraph have made less than 120 monthly payments under paragraph (1)(A).

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Education shall—

paragraph.text: inform each borrower of a loan made under part D of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087a et seq.) of—

subparagraph.text: paragraph (5) of section 455(m) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087e(m)), as amended by this Act; and
the effect of such paragraph on loan cancellation under such section 455(m) (20 U.S.C. 1087e(m)); and

paragraph.text: provide information to such borrowers on how to change repayment plans.
